ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Unpack PHA data from a PHACrate

DESC.PARA: The unpack_bkg command unpacks PHA data from a FITS file or a PHACrate into a Sherpa data object. unpack_bkg always returns a list of PHA datasets, in order to handle both Type I and II PHA files. To select specific elements after unpacking, use the syntax file[0], file[1], etc.
If a filename is provided as input, a crate is created but hidden and cannot be used for other analysis in the session.

LIST.ITEM: filename|PHACrate - the name of the file (with path) or PHACrate which contains the PHA data
use_errors - read the statistical errors from the PHA file? default=False

DESC.PARA: Unpack the background spectrum into the object "bg1".
The spectrum is read into an PHACrate (named "bgcr") from the file 3c273.pha. The data is then unpacked into Sherpa from the crate.

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
